Skin Examination.purpose: Evaluate skin nodules and lesions consistent with histoid leprosy

content.content: Multiple dome-shaped, shiny nodules over back and thighs; firm, well-defined, painless lesions measuring approximately 2-4 cm.

content.caption: Multiple shiny nodules on the patient's back.

Skin Examination.interpretation: Findings are consistent with histoid leprosy.

Sensory Testing.purpose: Assess sensory loss in limbs and lesions

findings.content: Reduced sensation to light touch and pinprick in gloves-and-stocking distribution in hands and feet.

Sensory Testing.interpretation: Sensory loss indicates peripheral nerve involvement typical in leprosy.

findings.content: Thickening of ulnar and lateral popliteal nerves noted on palpation.

Peripheral Nerve Palpation.interpretation: Indicates peripheral neuropathy associated with leprosy.

Motor Function Testing.purpose: Evaluate motor function in hands and feet

findings.content: Motor function appears intact with normal muscle strength in upper and lower limbs.

Motor Function Testing.interpretation: Motor function is preserved despite sensory loss.

Nasal Mucosa Examination.purpose: Assess for nasal involvement with leprosy

findings.content: Normal nasal mucosa; no signs of nasal congestion or discharge.

Nasal Mucosa Examination.interpretation: No signs of nasal complications, ruling out advanced lepromatous involvement.

Eye Examination.purpose: Rule out ocular complications due to leprosy

findings.content: Normal findings; no conjunctival injection or keratitis.

Eye Examination.interpretation: No complications detected in the eye examination.

Slit-skin Smear.purpose: To confirm diagnosis of leprosy by identifying acid-fast bacilli

content.caption: Microscopic view showing AFB in slit-skin smear.

Slit-skin Smear.interpretation: Diagnosis of histoid leprosy is confirmed based on the smear results.

content.content: Histopathology shows spindle-shaped histiocytes with abundant AFB.

content.caption: Biopsy results indicating presence of AFB.

PCR for M. leprae.purpose: To detect M. leprae, particularly if drug resistance is suspected

results.content: PCR results pending, meant to detect rifampicin resistance if present.

PCR for M. leprae.interpretation: Continued monitoring necessary for drug resistance.

Complete Blood Count (CBC).purpose: Baseline data for monitoring treatment safety
Complete Blood Count (CBC).interpretation: CBC is within normal limits; no anemia or leukopenia.

Liver Function Test (LFT).purpose: Baseline liver function evaluation for treatment safety
Liver Function Test (LFT).interpretation: Liver function tests are normal; safe to proceed with treatment.

Renal Function Test (RFT).purpose: Baseline renal function evaluation prior to treatment
Renal Function Test (RFT).interpretation: Normal renal function; no contraindications for safety of prescribed drugs.

HIV Test.interpretation: No co-infection detected; standard treatment can proceed.

results.content: Results indicate reduced amplitude and slowed conduction velocity in both ulnar and peroneal nerves.

Nerve Conduction Studies.interpretation: Findings are consistent with peripheral nerve damage due to leprosy.
